alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have likely fallen in the past hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Excel and Repton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
